item.title: The Greedy Cave
item.description: The Greedy Cave is an ARPG. Ready your spells, sharpen your swords, boost your stats, enchant your equipement, study your enemies and beat the crap out of that dungeon !! If you like Diablo or Torchlight, the greedy cave is made for you !

item.title: Digfender
item.description: Digfender is the best tower defense I played in 2015. It’s not a creative game, it doesn’t have any surprises, but it’s well executed and perfectly balanced. All the towers are usefull, each specialisation has it’s importance, and there isn’t one better than the others. The gameplay is deep and has a lot of variety.

item.title: The Quest Keeper
item.description: The Quest Keeper is THE cross over between a dungeon crawler and Crossy Road. You play an adventurer trying to complete quests given by (no surpise here) The Quest Keeper (^_^). The quests will bring you in various environement full of danger: fire, spiders, traps, flying axes, dead archers, rotating saw, …

item.title: Sorcery
item.description: Today let’s check Sorcery. Do you know the “books where you are the Hero”? If you liked these books as much as me, you’ll love Sorcery, and if you don’t know them but like Fantastic books, you should really try it!

item.title: Rymdkapsel
item.description: Rymdkapsel took the essence realtime strategy (RTS) games and released it in a unique and pure experience.

item.title: About
item.description: This is my personal blog. The views expressed on these pages are mine alone and not those of my employer. I’m a game dev working at Supercell in the engine team. On my free time I write about indie mobile games that are either forgotten or never discovered, play quite some game, and even try to make some even if many stop at a very early proto stage. I also love graphics programming.
